page.title: 06Farming: Crops
page.content: Not too many cereals are grown in this area because it is too hilly for the combine harvester.Barley is the most widely grown cereal.Winter barley is sown in October as it can be harvested early.Spring barley is sown in March, weather permitting.Oil seed rape is a new cereal in this area sown and har- vested at a different time of year. Winter Oats and wheat are sown in Oct- ober.Most of the cereals are kept for animal feed.The surplus going to other farmers or feed mills.Grass is made in to silage and hay in June and July. Second silage is in August.Most potatoes grown in this area are sold at the farm gate.They are sown in April and harvested in October.Turnips are often grown to feed sheep but some are sold with potatoes.
